subject: Re: [junit] Setup inheritance
msgSnippet: Yikes. I only worked with a beta version of WSAD -- that is, before I left IBM -- so I ran into a few of its little bugs; but not that one. You have my
messageBody:
Yikes. I only worked with a beta version of WSAD -- that is, before I
left IBM -- so I ran into a few of its little bugs; but not that one.
You have my sympathies in that.

Which book has just disgusted you, then? Write me directly if you'd
rather not embarrass anyone on the world stage.

Chin up!

*********** REPLY SEPARATOR ***********

On 2002-07-19 at 08:08 Eric Heikkila wrote:

>Oh no, of course not ;)
>
>Actually, I just had IBM Websphere Studio Application
>Developer delete a couple of my project directories
>while I was in the middle of editting them, for no
>apparent reason. Twice. So I'm in a bit of a mood.
>
>That, and I'm really tired of buying a book, starting
>to read through it, realizing I know more than the
>yahoo that wrote it (or, rather, more than he/she
>included in the text), and toss it aside in disgust.
>
>-Eric
>
>--- "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbr@...>
>wrote:
>> I probably meant "inheritance in Java," as in
>> extends, implements,
>> super and all that rot.
>>
>> You're not lumping me in with the "long-winded" are
>> you? :)
>>
>> *********** REPLY SEPARATOR ***********
>>
>> On 2002-07-19 at 07:36 Eric Heikkila wrote:
>>
>> >Read up on inheritence? hehehe...funny. You can
>> >probably sum it up in one sentence.
>> >
>> >Of course, then, the long-winded and/or 'teacher'
>> (or
>> >certifier) types out there would be out of a job.
>> ;)
>> >
>> >-Eric
>> >
>> >--- "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbr@...>
>> >wrote:
>> >> Hm. I think our original poster just missed out
>> on a
>> >> chance to learn
>> >> something.
>> >>
>> >> To the original poster: please read up on
>> >> inheritance anyway -- if
>> >> you're a student, then it's good for you to know
>> >> about, and if you're a
>> >> professional, people out there will assume you
>> know
>> >> it.
>> >>
>> >> Best of luck.
>> >>
>> >> *********** REPLY SEPARATOR ***********
>> >>
>> >> On 2002-07-18 at 15:46 Eric Heikkila wrote:
>> >>
>> >> >Shorter answer...
>> >> >
>> >> >... make sure you have something like the
>> >> following:
>> >> >
>> >> >public BaseClass extends TestCase {
>> >> >
>> >> > public void setUp() {
>> >> > System.out.println("BaseClass");
>> >> > }
>> >> >}
>> >> >
>> >> >public KiddieClass extends BaseClass {
>> >> > public void setUp() {
>> >> > super.setUp();
>> >> > System.out.println("Kiddie");
>> >> > }
>> >> >}
>> >> >
>> >> >----------------------------------------
>> >> >(Make sure you're calling super.setUp() in the
>> >> child
>> >> >classes).
>> >> >
>> >> >
>> >>
